description.narrative: The project entails the expansion of Sierra Rutile Limited (SRL), a mineral sands mining operation with a 50-year history producing high quality rutile and smaller quantities of ilmenite and zircon. The expansion is expected to increase production from current levels of about 150,000 tons per annum up to 300,000 tons per annum and extend the life of SRLs operations by ~20 years. The expansion encompasses a staged approach to several projects, including expansions at the existing operations of Lanti Dry and Gangama (already underway, with commissioning planned in mid-2019), as well as a potential new mining development at the Sembehun group of deposits.

The project is expected to generate positive balance of payments and fiscal effects by increasing Sierra Leone's foreign exchange earnings and generating significant revenue streams to the Government through royalties and corporate taxes over the life of mine. The project will also support indirect and induced jobs in the economy, while sustaining employment of ~2,700 people, 98% of whom are Sierra Leonean. The project also has positive impact on the local community, deriving from SRL's contribution to an Agriculture Development Fund that supports agricultural development in its catchment areas, and community development projects in infrastructure, education, health and agriculture supported under a Community Development Agreement. In addition, IFC will provide advisory services to assist the company in enhancing its community level impacts, through joint development of economic development programs and deepening supply chain linkages. Through IFC's E&S and advisory services, and Iluka's strong ESG practices, the project will also support international best practice in environmental and social impact management, and in community engagement.
